Methods

| Improve this Doc View Source

CreatePopulation(MetaNeatGenome<T>, double, int, IRandomSource?)

Create a new NeatPopulation<T> with randomly initialised genomes. Genomes are randomly initialised by giving each a random subset of all possible connections between the input and output layer.

Declaration
public static NeatPopulation<T> CreatePopulation(MetaNeatGenome<T> metaNeatGenome, double connectionsProportion, int popSize, IRandomSource? rng = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
MetaNeatGenome<T> metaNeatGenome

Genome metadata, conveys e.g. the number of input and output nodes that each genome should have.
double connectionsProportion

The proportion of possible connections between the input and output layers, to create in each new genome.
int popSize

Population size.
IRandomSource rng

Random source (optional).
Returns
Type Description
NeatPopulation<T>

A new instance of NeatPopulation<T>.
| Improve this Doc View Source

CreatePopulation(MetaNeatGenome<T>, int, NeatGenome<T>, NeatReproductionAsexualSettings, WeightMutationScheme<T>, IRandomSource?)

Create a new NeatPopulation<T> based on a single seed genome.

Declaration
public static NeatPopulation<T> CreatePopulation(MetaNeatGenome<T> metaNeatGenome, int popSize, NeatGenome<T> seedGenome, NeatReproductionAsexualSettings reproductionAsexualSettings, WeightMutationScheme<T> weightMutationScheme, IRandomSource? rng = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description

int popSize

Population size.
NeatGenome<T> seedGenome

The seed genome.
NeatReproductionAsexualSettings reproductionAsexualSettings

Asexual reproduction settings.
WeightMutationScheme<T> weightMutationScheme

Connection weight mutation scheme.
IRandomSource rng
